definition: extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon

sentences.english: The salesman said this is a "once-in-a-life-time" chance.
sentences.chinese: 那個銷售員說這是一個千載難逢的機會。

sentences.english: How could you miss such a once-in-a-blue-moon chance?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼能錯過這個千載難逢的機會呢？

sentences.english: Shut up, because here comes one-time-only opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 不過現在有了一個千載難逢的好機會。

sentences.english: This may be the chance of a life-time.
sentences.chinese: 這機會可謂是千載難逢。
這是一個千載難逢的機會。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that Liuyang Fireworks encounter a golden opportunity for development.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，瀏陽花炮遇到了一個千載難逢的發展機遇。

sentences.english: It's an opportunity in a million, and we shouldn't waste it.
sentences.chinese: 這個機會千載難逢，我們萬萬不可浪費。

definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to take turns/to work by roster
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
